newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil June unemployment up at 6.09 pct - IBGE.
newsitem.headline: Brazil June unemployment up at 6.09 pct - IBGE.

text.p: Brazil's June unemployment rate rose to 6.09 percent from six percent in May, while the unemployment rate for the first half of this year fell to 5.74 percent from 5.86 percent in the first half of 1996, the National Statistics Institute (IBGE) said.
June's unemployment rate also rose a negligible amount in comparison with June 1996, the IBGE said.
"These changes are statistically insignificant," the IBGE said in a statement.
In the first half of this year the number of people working increased one percent in comparison with 1996, the IBGE said.

The number of people working only increased in the northeastern city of Salvador and remained stable in the southern city of Porto Alegre in June, while the remaining four of six urban centers surveyed recorded falls in the number of people employed, the IBGE said.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
